campaign.story:
The 7th Annual New York City Poetry Festival will be held on Governors Island on July 29th and 30th, 2017. That's right, New Yorkers! Your city's own poetry festival, the largest gathering of its kind, returns this summer -- and with exciting news. After six years wrapped in the breezy embrace of Colonel's Row, The New York City Poetry Festival is migrating east across the island to picturesque Nolan Park. The move is designed to give our growing festival a little breathing room and some new possibilities. Nolan Park is more than twice the size of Colonel's Row, ringed with a collection of beautiful Victorian houses, and tucked beneath the wide, green canopies of dozens of century old trees. This summer we will transform our festival into a poetry village! In addition to our three main stages, along with The Ring of Daisies Open Mic and The Children's Poetry Festival, Governor's Island has invited us to occupy and program the trellised porches that circle the park. With all this new space to explore, we are working harder than ever to bring more poetry and poetry lovers to the island. 
Nolan Park
With that in mind and with the help of our newest festival partner The Strand Bookstore, we are redoubling our outreach in order to make this the biggest and most culturally significant festival we have ever produced. We would love for you to take part: host a reading, become a vendor, volunteer for the festival, or get involved in some other creative way that we haven't even come up with yet!
Ariel Kleinberg performing "Fish Tanks" at the 2016 #NYCPOFEST
The goal of The New York City Poetry Festival is to be the most egalitarian and inclusive poetry gathering in the world. Since it's inception the festival has remained free and open to the public. Any group or organization involved in the creation or appreciation of poetry is invited to curate a thirty minute reading on one of the festival's three main stages, and all completed applications are accepted on a first come first served basis until the festival roster is full.  We also offer tables to any organization or vendor who wishes to participate in our Vendors' Village / Book Fair at a rate of $50 for the entire weekend.
Poetry hanging from the trees!
This year we will welcome back more than 75 New York City poetry groups, including venerable institutions, upstarts, small presses, local reading series, literary journals, high school poetry teams, and more to The Festival’s three stages. If year’s past are any indication, over 300 poets will present, and we've already booked some incredible headliners including Aja Monet, Sapphire, Deborah Landau, and Patrick Phillips. 
Our 2017 Headliners!
This year also welcomes back our Vendors Village packed with local artisans, literary journals, and small presses, as well as The Festival’s Ring of Daisies Open-Mic, which is often the hottest mic on Governor’s Island. And The Children’s Poetry Festival, sponsored by Writopia Lab, will give our youngest festival attendees a chance to encounter the magic that brought us all to poetry in the first place.
New work from the 2012 #NYCPOFEST!
As always, the purpose of the New York City Poetry Festival has been to liberate poets and their work from the dark corners of bars, bookstore, and coffee shops and their halogen-lit college campuses, and to bring together as many NYC poets as possible, in the bright light of day, to meet, mingle, and collaborate. Fostering an open, approachable, diverse, innovative, sharp, and culturally prominent literary community lies at the core of The Poetry Society of New York's mission. While there are still a few entrenched poetry establishments, for many writers and artists, and even the general public, they can seem remote and inaccessible; The Poetry Society of New York aims not only to bridge these gaps, but to unify this city's poetry community in ways never before thought possible.
Lucia Stacey reading at the 2015 #NYCPOFEST!
This year's festival planning is already going strong, and we will make announcements here over the next few weeks. So, donate today to stay up-to-date on the lineup and other featured activities! Oh, and Kickstarter supporters who donate $50 or more even get access to the historic Commanding Officer's House, our exclusive VIP area for members of The Poetry Society of New York and festival sponsors where free drinks and refreshments will be served all day!
The Commanding Officer's House
 Thank you so much for supporting The Poetry Society of New York in its production of the 7th Annual New York City Poetry Festival on Governors Island. Contributors can take great pride and deep pleasure in this gathering—the largest, most participatory poetry festival in the world—which belongs to New York City. With your help the festival will flourish in 2017 and continue to grow in size, quality, and acclaim in the years to come.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any great endeavor, there are always potential risks and challenges that one might have to overcome. As the organizers of a two-day outdoor festival, our biggest fear is always the weather. Should we be hit with rain on the planned dates, we will get wet... but with a decent happiness.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Morphology of War 1
  The Morphology of War 2
"The Morphology of War" is a project of large-scale digital graphic murals that focuses on the idea that each society gives birth to its own monsters. In the times of conflict, they procreate. A friend changes his shape and becomes an enemy – unfamiliar, ridiculous, potentially dangerous. He experiences severe morphological changes. 
Most of the images were taken from European illuminated manuscripts and bestiaries and reinterpreted in the medium of digital large-scale graphics. The murals are printed in photographic-quality print on wallpaper, then they are glued to the wall. This requires producing new murals for each exhibition because the material is not re-usable. Funds are needed for printing 6 murals to cover 1130 sq ft (105 sq m) in total. The exhibition I would like to fund will be open at the National Center of Arts in Mexico City, 4 May-28 May. Everyone is cordially invited. 
  The Morphology of War 3
  The Morphology of War 4
The absurdity of history does not change with centuries. It has potential to emerge, or to be invoked, by particular political events, from international conflicts in Ukraine and Syria to terrorist threats in Europe, drug conflicts in Mexico, and the political tension in the U.S. In the context of global fear, the project is called to reflect the initial grotesqueness of any kind of armed conflict. Collective unconsciousness influenced by mass media propaganda produces "monsters" embodied by real people. This project seeks to explore how traditionalism provokes an escalation of violence and how deeply these destructive instincts are rooted in the visual culture. 
Artist with a mural
   Exhibition view
 The continuous line of monsters is reminiscent of the symbolism of the dance of the dead by Ingmar Bergman that concludes his film "The Seventh Seal". The project “The Morphology of War” is on view at the Museo Taller Erasto Cortés in Puebla until 24 April. The expanded version of the project will form part of the exhibition programme of the Esmeralda School of Plastic Arts in the National Centre of Arts in Mexico City, with the exhibition on 04-28 May 2017. The murals from the project will also be part of the 5th International Biennale in Odessa in August 2017.
Artist with a mural
  Exhibition view
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The first edition of the project is taking place at the Museo Taller Erasto Cortes in Puebla, so the whole process of production had been tested and there no risks expected.

campaign.story:
Around 17 years ago I learned the ancient art of the mosaic in Ravenna, Italy. The permanence of the art form is what drew me in first. Marble and glass do not fade. Mortar is mortar. An ancient mosaic looks exactly as intended by the artist who produced it over two millennia ago. What else can claim that kind of staying power? I find this idea simply amazing. Since my experience in Italy, I've devoted myself to changing people's perception of what a mosaic could be. Using the same materials, tools, and methods of the archaic craftsmen, I create mosaics that speak of modern things in an ancient voice. From junk food to coffee to breakfast cereal, my work permanently locks into mortar unexpected concepts drawn from the present.
The original pothole installation on May 20, 2013
On May 20, 2013, I began to apply this thinking to the numerous potholes filling the streets of Chicago. Temporarily fixed over and over again by city street crews, the potholes cried out for something more resilient, and far more aesthetically pleasing than a patch of asphalt. Early concepts of the artwork that I first installed branded the pothole as an authentic "Chicago-style" pothole. Other, early creations included serial numbers (to represent the vast number of city potholes), phone numbers of nearby auto repair shops (to offer convenient access to auto wheel repairs) and even flowers (as a pretty juxtaposition to the universally ugly pothole.) My ten-piece 2015 campaign called "Treats in the Streets" featured classic ice cream treats. That Kickstarter project even help partially fund installing 6 pieces in Jyväskylä, Finland. In addition to Chicago installs, last year I was able to piggyback on existing travel plans and install new work in Los Angeles, San Antonio, Detroit, and Philadelphia. I hope to put new work in the ground in a few more cities this year if possible.
"Strawberry Shortcake" from the "Treats in the Streets" series.
  "Banana Peel" from the "Pretty Trashed" series.
  "Cheetos" from the "Pretty Trashed" series.
The project has been featured on news outlets from around the world including CBS Sunday Morning (click here), PBS, ABC News, the UK's Daily Mail, Oprah's magazine "O", Hyperallergic, and many others. A recent piece was even featured on the cover of the March 2017 issue of Chicago magazine.
March 2017 issue of Chicago Magazine
It's early 2017 now and pothole season will soon be upon us. Since these works of art are permanently affixed to the ground, I can't sell them. What I'm looking for is a little funding for this year's new series of pieces. Any funds raised beyond my goal will finance further installations. I have a ton of new ideas for future pieces! Take a look at my website (http://www.bachor.com/4600-north-kenton---map) to see examples of the pieces I've installed so far and check out the interactive map.
A $5 donation gets you a POTHOLE sticker while $7 gets you a patch!
  A signed print, featuring one of the installations from the 2017 campaign, is your reward (along with a patch and sticker) for donations starting at $30!
  A pothole T-shirt, featuring one of the installations from the 2017 campaign, is your reward (along with a patch and sticker) for a donation of $50!
  The 2nd edition of the pothole art installation book is your reward (along with a patch and sticker) for a donation of $100! (Signed copies are $125.) The 2nd edition will look different than this, but you get the idea.
  A quilted Pothole Art Project "Groundskeeper" jacket will keep you warm and stylish all winter and it can be your reward, along with a patch and sticker, for a contribution of $250.
Thank you for considering donating to the 2017 Pothole Project!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
After about the sixth installation I think I have the technique down pat. (I've now done around 45 pieces of pothole art.) Temperature plays a big part of the process and April is a good time for me to start, since it's usually warm enough for the mortar to set properly. Given that my canvas is a city street, the artwork occasionally gets paved over or patched with asphalt. But that comes with playing the street. For me the only risks/challenges are making sure not to get hit by a car during an installation. There is a limitless supply of pothole candidates and, when the weather cooperates, an installation takes about 2 days to complete.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
hey everyone -
2nd edition books will start to ship out monday. i appreciate your patience!!
they will also go on sale on bachor.com at 930am that same day.
it's a limited edition of 300. Of the 300 produced only 230 or so copies remain available. What's the difference between the 1st and 2nd edition you ask? This one is hard bound (!) with foil stamps on the front and back covers. It also has an embossed dust jacket so you can feel as if you're in the middle of a street running your hands across a piece of pothole art (for some unknown reason.) It runs 312 pages! (around 50 more than the 1st edition) and is updated with the 2017 installs. Like last year's book it also has the ever critical orange place holder ribbon. The only thing it doesn't do is glow in the dark. Perhaps we'll do that with the 3rd edition in a few years. (Killer book design work again this year from Chicago's Galambos + Associates!)

hey fab backers -
i'm scheduled to sign all 300 copies of the 2nd edition of the pothole art book this monday at the printer.
won't be long now - thank you for your patience!
bachor
p.s. if you're interested in a book they are one of the many offerings of THE 2018 NYC Kickstarter pothole art campaign - there's still with that one. check out all the rewards !

Hey backers - Here’s a mock-up of the book! Hope to be shipping out copies in a month. Thanks for your patience! Bachor (P.S. I just launched a new Kickstarter project to do a series in New York City!)

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE on the 2nd edition of the pothole art book
updates.update_content: Hey backers- Another install in the books! This one is a new edition of the 1st piece of pothole art I installed back in May of 2013. It’s just west of the intersection of Kedvale and Argyle in Chicago. Also - for those of you waiting on tees - they just arrived and will ship out early this week. As it looks like it’s gonna start getting cold here this might be the last install of 2017. The good news is work on the 2nd edition of the pothole art book can begin! More later - Bachor

campaign.story:
We've Gone Global
Back in September 2016, Citizens Advertising Takeover Service launched the first takeover at Clapham Station in London.
PLAY

So we are now taking it across the pond and launch the first one in the USA, starting with the nation's capital. 
We want to takeover a small DC metro station...something like Dupont Circle or even Cleveland Park (in honor of Ollie, the National Zoo's bobcat). 
The posters could look like this...
Whoa...How?
If we raise enough funds, we can probably takeover half of a small station. But if we raise more than our goal...we could take over the whole station or maybe a station domination (wishful thinking). 
ALSO...we are working Animal Welfare League of Montgomery County to provide us with photos of their kitties.
Take me home?
But...Why?
Because...why not? It may be a silly project, but it's a distraction from the chaotic lives we live. It's a way to step out of the norm of ads on the Metro...away from convincing us to buy a brand new car, or looking mighty fine in a brand new pair of jeans...or politics. 
Even if cats won't make you happy, admit it...you will smile once you walk past one of these. 
This is just a mock-up. Credit to whoever created this Photoshop file, can't remember who you are.
Who knows, maybe it will make your day or even your whole month (because that's how long these ads will be up at a Metro station)!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
1) Our starting goal is $30,000 because we think it's realistic, even if we only cover half a station. If we raise more than that, then we can take over 3/4 of a station...or the whole station! 

2) Possible risk to people who are allergic to cats: Their dander does not transfer to print.

3) If the project isn't successful, your credit card will not be charged.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

DC Kitties

support.title: Kitty Keepsakes
support.descp:
Submit a photo of your cat and we will place him on an official C.A.T.S. ad sent to you by e-mail. These files will be in high-resolution so you can print them up to 8" x 10"
Don't own a cat? Choose from one of our featured cats or we can choose one for you.

support.title: Show-Off
support.descp: Choose from two t-shirt designs! You can play it safe with "I Can't Keep Calm. C.A.T.S. Are Taking Over Metro!" or be daring and choose "Show Me Your Kitties."

support.title: The Show-Off & Their Plus One
support.descp: We didn't think it would be fair if another cat lover you care about didn't get a t-shirt as well. So for an extra $20, you can receive another t-shirt. Of course, you can choose from the two different designs.

support.title: The Basic Cat Person Kit
support.descp:
Receive an official C.A.T.S. sticker, a mug, a magnet, and a T-shirt of your choice.
You can also choose which design you want. Options make the world go round, you know.

support.title: Immediate Cat Fame
support.descp: Your cat will be featured on one of the ads. We'll reserve a 4" x 4" square for your cat, polaroid style, on a poster. Just send us a photo and BOOM! Your cat is famous. We will also email you the location of the poster.

support.title: The Bundle
support.descp: Your cat will be featured on a poster with the other cats. BFFs kitty style.

support.title: Group Hug
support.descp: We will feature up to 4 cats on this poster, without any branding. This can be split between your 4 cats, or your cat and your friend's 3 cats, or your 3 cats and your friend's cat, or your cat and 3 other friend's cats...well, you get the idea.

support.title: Whoa, Kitty!
support.descp: Your cat gets an entire poster on the metro. We'll hire a professional photographer to make them look incredible and they'll appear on a pure background with no logo, and no distractions. Thousands will stop, stare, and love.

updates.update_content:
We are approaching the final hours of this campaign. To those who have supported this from Day 1 - thank you! Even though it seems like this first go-round will not happen, maybe the second one will. If by miracle we reach our goal within the next 16 hours - that would really make my year! 
There is a Plan B. As I mentioned in the previous update, yes...we have to do this all over again. That means a new intro video...but the rewards remain the same. If you haven't signed up yet to receive an update about Plan B, here's the sign-up form.  
Also, please check out Animal Welfare League of Montgomery County's website to see the adoptable cats and kittens. Please foster or adopt - so many cats (and dogs) out there that need forever homes!

With only 3 (more or less) days to go and the campaign isn't gaining much of a momentum, there is a huge possibility that I may have to pull the plug. However, because I am one of those people who won't quit until I get what I want - I do have a back up plan...
If the campaign isn't full funded by the final hour, then I will have to move on to Plan B. If you'd like to take part in Plan B, please fill out this sign up form so I can send you an update. No, I will not use your email address to spam you.

campaign.story:
Easiseat by MoNi Studio
Easiseat is an innovative furniture aim to improve home life for elderly and disabled persons. Especially the severely disabled persons who have to take cared by nursing attendant, but still having many difficulties is their daily life. Esiseat is designed to reduce those difficulties and the hard works of nursing attendants by providing ultimate mobility, toilet accessibility and wireless controlled.
Toilet accessible
Easiseat is fully integrated with a set of mechanism, which assist the sitter to use toilet at their home easily. 
  Easibelt is an accessory of Easiseat, purposed for severely disabled persons who put no force on clamping the Body Holder that attached on the Backrest. With the Easibelt on, the sitter can be lifted in a total relaxed state.
The video shows how an interested customer was lifting up in total relaxed state.
PLAY

 Manoeuverable 
Easiseat is highly manoeuverable, allows spin, lateral and diagonal movements. Particularly fits to the tiny flats in urban area.
   Wireless control
Easiseat is controlled wirelessly, that convenient to the nursing attendants who taking care of an elderly or disabled persons.   
   Innovative Furniture
Easiseat is not only about the technology that provides solution to those in needed, we also focus on Design, Craftsmanship and Durability. We choose wood is hopping the timeless and the natural beauty from the intricate surface of wood can bring an aesthetic pleasure and comfortable experience to users . And the joint we used for the way of wood-working is building up the durability of Easiseat.
   Why crowd funding?
Easiseat can actually improves home life for elderly and disabled persons at different levels. However the handcrafted wood-working process takes so much time and eventually makes the cost high. We hope that Easiseat can be affordable to those who need it, so doing a conversion from handcrafted process to digital fabrication is the best way to cost down the production. Despite we started Easiseat with 3D modeling, the joints and the way of constructing it are still on handcraft basis. So we need your support to fund us from the very beginning of revising the 3D model and re-do all the joints for suiting the fabrication way of CNC , till everything is tested and ready for automatic production.
Another reason is to improve the Easiseat in some points that we collected from testers.
1. We are going to add the suspension system on the rear wheels of Easiseat, for those users who want Easiseat to go through rough terrain.
2. The transmitter, we will re-shape the transmitter to a more dynamic form , it will be able to attach on the armrest if the sitters want to control by themselves.
3. We will add a pair of battery indicators on the transmitter, show the battery levels of Easiseat and the transmitter itself.
4. Make variation in size, let the users be able to find one that fits to their body and still can go through the doors
5. Make few prototypes with digital fabrication for testing the limitation with every approach such as crush test, shock absorbing test, etc.
Testers
Easiseat has been tested by different testers. the feedback and comments from them will be incorporated into the revision
1. Mrs SO, a patient with Multiple Sclerosis, also is the director of Hong Kong Neuro-Muscular Disease Association
 2. Mrs Chun is attracted by the design and innovation of Easiseat. Would like to have a test for her parents.
 3. Mrs Tsang suffer from knee Degeneration.
 Exhibitions 
Easiseat has and will be attending some exhibitions, to hear as more comment from visitors, from their view of points for improving Easiseat. Just one month we finished Easiseat, we have attended Opening Ceremony of  the Smart Living for Aging at Hong Kong Science and Technology Park and Maker Faire Hong Kong 2017. The upcoming exhibition will  be the International ICT Expo 2017 and Gerontech and Innovation Expo cum Summit 2017. Every fans of Kickstarter are welcome to visit Easiseat at the exhibition mentioned above.
 About the small reward Key-ring 
For backers who pledge us HK$120, we are rewarding them with a special key-ring of the logo of MoNi Studio to appreciate their great support to Easiseat. It is made of two materials,  solid wood on front side and stainless steel on back side. The solid wood gives warm and natural beauty to the key-ring while the stainless steel strengthens the logo.
 Specification 
Timeline
We were trying to made the timeline as detail as possible, because we want the backers to be part of us. We share what we did on the past and transparent every stage the Easiseat will be facing on the progress of putting onto digital fabrication and production.
 Our Team
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Battery safety is out most concern. We promised that we only use certificated batteries in Easiseat.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
We love Cats on Amps and the entire community who supports and contributes to our daily posts on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter. For a while, we have been considering making a gorgeous hardcover photo book. We have decided that now is the time!
We will need your help. Over the next 60 days we will plan out this entire project together. We envision using this project to establish our full web presence which will include a public database for submissions (individuals can chose to submit anonymously or allow their contact information to be public), and readying both our first photo book and a 2018 Cats on Amps Calendar.
Here are a few examples of Cats on Amps photos that have been featured on our social media pages and in past calendars.
           And here are examples of photos we are considering for inclusion in our Photo Book!
Elmer on a Dr. Z head. Photo courtesy of Ryan from the band Modern Sons.
 KICKSTARTER CATS ON AMPS HOODIE.
Cats on Amps Kickstarter Hoodie (Front)
  Cats on Amps Kickstarter Hoodie (Back)
If you have a photograph that you would like to submit for consideration please email us at CatsonAmps@Gmail.com.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are fairly seasoned at running Cats on Amps and our record label, Magnetic Eye Records. We understand these are large projects involving many tasks that require attention. In addition, communication with backers thru every stage of the project is also crucial. As always, we will do our best to balanace all these competing priorities.

Finally, we love a good challenge. We look forward to being successful in funding and delivering one of THE coolest photo books ever made.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Do you ever walk down the street and have some random two-legged cat call out at you?
Do you ever walk down the street and have some random four-legged cat meow at you?
Do you have trouble distinguishing between the two? 
We're here to help. Pledge to receive our handmade illustrated zine of cat calls. For additional monetary support, you can contribute a cat call to be considered for illustration. We're also making stickers so that you can spread cat calls worldwide.
<3,
Carol & KPan

updates.update_userinfo: Cat Calls are in the mail
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,
On Friday afternoon, Katherine and I printed and assembled the zines. KPan took the lead on printing and she learned a lot. All rewards have been dropped in the mail (unless you work with us, in which case we hand-delivered your reward).
We both love how the stickers came out and we can't wait to see how you use them. Tag us on Instagram when you stick 'em!

Hello hello!
Carol and KPan writing to you right from the printer in our office. We've got some draft versions of the zine to share!

Hello friends, family, and strangers,

Hello old friends and new friends,
Thanks for believing in Cat Calls. We're less than $100 away from making our goal and spreading prolific cat calls worldwide. I got cat called this weekend and am so appreciative for the new material. It must be the nice weather. Is spring peak cat calling season?
Katherine and I would love to share some of our favorite meows with you.

campaign.story:
The Full (6) Landscape Model Set
'Power Absorbent Landscapes' is a series of six sculptural landscape models produced as part of the independent art, architecture, & research project ON THE GREAT DIVIDE. Cut from three different regions of Wyoming, each model contains a section of The Great Divide Mountain Bike Route which I'll be riding late this summer. The A-series represents the landscape to a true scale. The B-Series highlights the disproportionate voting power found in Wyoming by allowing the landscape to absorb the high vote worth resulting in an exaggerated elevation model. 'Power Absorbent Landscapes' helps visualize the abstract concept of voting power and becomes a reflection of the peaks and valleys of a divided nation. And yet, the series can also be appreciated simply for the power held by visually stunning landscapes cut out of the earth and brought into your home or office.
*For a limited time you can get all three B-Series (1:3) Models for the price of 2! Separated, you can have museum quality pieces in 3 different spots, or combine them to have a piece that is 6"x18". When hung with the satellite image prints that are included, the mixed media art work is an eye-catching 12"x18 which looks great as a centerpiece.
01A&01B_Angle Mountain at True and Exaggerated Scale
  01B_Angle Mountain Power Absorbent Model
Each of the 6 models are cut from a 6mi.x6mi. area and are scaled down to measure 6"x6". They are made from USG Pottery Plaster No.1, a high quality plaster known for being more dense and break-resistant than a typical plaster of paris model. 
The plaster models feature a minutely (0.1mm) contoured surface translated over from the 3D printed parts used in the fabrication process. These contours create a shadow catching textural quality. The sides of the model are made smooth for contrast. As these are handmade in individual batches in a small work space, there will be a very slight variation between each landscape.
The Full (6) Landscape Model Set
They range between 1 3/8" to 3 3/8" high and weigh between 1.75 lbs. and 3 lbs. The backs are also drilled so that they may be suitable for vertical display.
Where Your Funding Goes
These models are one component of the On the Great Divide is a 3,000 mile bike tour/multidisciplinary research project exploring the space & architecture of vastness, power, and populism along the Great Divide Mountain Bike Route. This project will leverage the process of a bicycle tour to study the relationships between sublime landscapes, the sparse architecture which nestles and dots these landscapes, the people who inhabit these spaces, and the way in which these environments shape and are shaped by their ideologies.
The proceeds go to furthering the quality and depth of research. Things like having additional time to study a town, or to interview architects become possible. Funding also goes towards shop equipment that will be used to increase capacity of the landscape sculptures. The end goal is to exhibit a field of these landscapes paired with the photography of the trip. Maybe hundreds of them, each one unique.
For more information please visit onthegreatdivide.com
Voting Power Translated to Elevation Change
As seen from the map above, the white square of Wyoming is prominent for its voting power compared to every other state. Each state receives a minimum of three Electoral College votes allowing for large distortions of voting power to occur. By design, and for better or for worse, this feature makes sure the rural leanings have a big say in national priorities despite growing urban populations.
Depending on how it is calculated, one vote in Wyoming is worth 3 to 4 times more than a vote in California. The B-series of the landscape models use that number to the change of elevation on the landscape. The A-Series of the landscapes are the exact scale as they sit on the earth, but its pair has peaks 3.5 times higher. In this way the two model sets make for a quick visual of what 1:1 voting power looks like compared to 1:3.5.
The Process
Selecting which landscapes to represent was a careful process to curate the various conditions found in the state of Wyoming. A key component of the On the Great Divide project is fabricating the landscapes along the route. Mapmaking helped to locate the intersections between the Great Divide Mountain Bike Route and available USGS landscape data.
With those intersections found, the elevation data is digitally modeled to reveal the character of the potential sites. From 34 landscapes, 3 were selected for their visual presence and contrast of form, geology, and ecology.
  Satellite Imagery Used in Prints
Model 01 of Angle Mountain contains a portion of the high peaks of the Rocky Mountains in north western Wyoming full of deep valleys. Model 02 of Coal Mine Creek features the striated low ridges of the high altitude desert basin in a spot where wild horses run free. Model 03 of Grieve Reservoir features the mix of plains and buttes which continue on through Colorado.
Making 'Power Absorbent Landscapes'
 1. Digital models are 3D Printed @ 1”=1 Mile resulting in a 6”x6” final product. The edges are sanded and finished with an epoxy to ensure a smooth cross section.
2. The prototype is then coated with a thin wax to provide a small level of smoothing necessary for better cast removal. Rubber latex is then poured over the prototype to create a reusable mold.
3. Once the mold has dried, they are sprayed with a release agent and surfactant which breaks the surface tension of plaster to decrease the number of air bubbles in the final sculpture.
4. Sculpture quality plaster is carefully measured and mixed by hand with filtered water. 
5. Plaster is carefully poured into the mold with a formwork to retain the rectangular form. Casts are vibrated to bring air bubbles to the surface.
6. Casts are air dried for several days with the last remaining moisture removed through a short period of forced air heat drying with increased ventilation. They bottoms and sides are then hand sanded to ensure a smooth finish. The bottoms are then drilled, signed, titled, and numbered.
  The Landscape Models
1A_ANGLE MOUNTAIN TRUE LANDSCAPE MODEL - PROTOTYPE
  1B_ANGLE MOUNTAIN ABSORBENT LANDSCAPE MODEL - FINAL PRODUCT
  1A/1B_ANGLE MOUNTAIN TRUE/ABSORBENT LANDSCAPE MODELS
  2A_COAL MINE RIDGE TRUE LANDSCAPE MODEL - PROTOTYPE
  2B_COAL MINE RIDGE ABSORBENT LANDSCAPE MODEL - PROTOTYPE
  2A/2B_COAL MINE RIDGE TRUE/ABSORBENT LANDSCAPE MODELS
  3A_GREIVE RESERVOIR TRUE LANDSCAPE MODEL - PROTOTYPE
  3B_GREIVE RESERVOIR ABSORBENT LANDSCAPE MODEL - PROTOTYPE
   3A/3B_GREIVE RESERVOIR TRUE/ABSORBENT LANDSCAPE MODELS
  About Me
Hi I'm Myles Peña and I’m a designer, maker, and architectural thinker working in the Pacific Northwest. Very early in life I discovered my passions riding bikes on gravel roads in rural Texas when I was four and drawing and designing houses late at night under the covers in my Florida bedroom by the age of eight. I learned to appreciate cycling as a discipline as I worked as a bicycle mechanic and while racing Cyclocross and Road bikes. After studies in Urban & Regional Planning and Art History at Florida State University, I continued on to pursue Architecture at the Illinois Institute of Technology in Chicago while fabricating furniture and studying economics in my spare time. At IIT I designed several award winning projects and learned to embrace a rigorous design process rooted in research and experimentation. After graduation I worked helping to design and construct a maker space before spending four months bike touring and camping on rural backroads from Chicago to San Francisco. Enamored with the landscape I took the long route riding up to Jasper, Alberta, down to Seattle, and finally down the Pacific coast to San Francisco while focusing on landscape photography. In 2016 I moved to Seattle where I now work as an architectural designer on educational institutions.
You can see more of my work, my resume, and other projects at zmpena.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With the most complex and largest landscape, 1B, developed to the form and materiality of the final product, I've successfully been able to begin producing these quickly. The full process from mixing to drying to packaging and shipping has already been tested so I can get making these as the Kickstarter runs. If you have any questions please don't hesitate to reach out by clicking on my name on the top left of the page and sending me a message or leaving a comment on the page. Thanks for stopping by.

updates.update_userinfo: On The Great Divide is on tomorrow. Follow along at onthegreatdivide.com
updates.update_content:
Tomorrow morning I will be getting on my bike to ride thousands of miles for the travel and research portion of the On The Great Divide. With the castings and prints done, shipped, and delivered, the On The Great Divide website is finally updated. It now has all of your wonderful names on the supporter's list. As I was updating that portion I was again overcome with all of your generosity. Thank you all so much again; it means a lot to me personally to have your support. I hope everyone is enjoying the addition of a little section of visualized political power and a powerful landscape in your space.
In the last week additional features were also added to the site to give a more detailed look at the process of the travel portion of the project. A satellite tracker at 5 minute intervals will be updated hourly while a photography feed, and a log book will be updated as frequently as wifi and data allows (which may be as little as once a week).

updates.update_userinfo: From powder to liquid, every one has solidified into a mountain.
updates.update_content: When 200 pounds of plaster showed up on my doorstep, in addition to the 50lbs I already had in my house, it was a daunting moment to say the least. After a few weeks of cleaning, mixing, pouring, waiting, and repeating and repeating and repeating, I've emptied out five 50lb bags of plaster (with the water mixed its over 425lbs of landscapes). Now we wait a bit for the pieces to dry fully (they are a bit stubborn just due to their mass). After that, a couple days of sanding, drilling, marking, and packing they'll be ready to ship! Between working, prepping for this trip and project, and getting these things poured, it has been a handful. I'd like to thank my supporters and those close to me for their patience during this production period and especially my roommate who hasn't minded me turning our apartment temporarily into a full blown plaster studio and is now living in my mess of landscapes, plaster, buckets, and bikepacking gear. Thank you.

After a few weeks of waiting for financing to come through, a few weeks of waiting for 150 pounds(!) of plaster and a few gallons of rubber latex to arrive on my doorstep, making and remaking initial forms for mold making, and getting a little rest after the campaign, production is going. Last weekend the rest of the molds were made and production spreadsheets were completed. After drying out, each one turned out wonderfully so now the plaster can start flowing!
Thank you so much for everyone's support and help! I couldn't have done it without each and every one of your contributions. Now the fun is just beginning; I can't wait to go into production!!
Check out the write up at http://www.bikepacking.com/news/gdmbr-landscapes/

campaign.story:
The Funkelbag
 The Funkelbag is a backpack with illuminated drawstrings.
Two AA batteries power the glowing El-Wires within the straps.
A second set of El-Wires is installed on the inside, on the bottom and the sides, behind white lining.
This allows you to see all the contents within the bag in complete darkness - without disturbing someone with a bright smartphone flashlight, or having to awkwardly handle the phone itself.
The inside wire is connected separately, and can be easily turned off in order to conserve battery power.
 Both El-Wires are surrounded by a strong and durable PVC mesh, increasing the diameter of the drawstrings to 5 mm, which makes the Funkelbag very sturdy and comfortable to wear.
One set of batteries lasts an average of 8 hours when the Funkelbag is set to continuous lighting mode. Setting the bag to strobe mode bumps battery life to 16 hours.
If you love the environment as much as we do, we recommend using rechargeable batteries.
Integrated on the inside is a small zip-locked pocket at the bottom, which is intended for the inverter. An additional larger pocket near the top gives room for items such as wallets, keys, phones, etc.
Two more pockets on the opposite side keep everything tidy and in order. It’s a German design, and we love order.
The outer material is designed to be as flashy as possible, to let you shine just as much during the day.
  PLAY

   What fits inside?
Exactly everything you need for your festival- and partynights.
  Holographic PVC
This magical material changes color with the angle of the light source. Absolutely stunning in the sunlight!
 Glitter PU leather
Softer than PVC, also very light sensitive. A subtler effect.
 Sequins
This is by far the most complicated fabric, and therefore the “premium” and most expensive variant.
The front side is packed tight with sequins sewn with two threads, the most durable method possible.
The back side is made from comfortable black cotton.
To keep the front as beautiful as one would expect, a common design was used for the straps: two loops of El-Wire on each side, creating the opening of the bag where they meet.
This effectively doubles the length of the wire, making the bag brighter.
    Because my supplier’s minimum order quantity is 500 pieces of each variant, the funding starts for the PVC bag, with a $10.000 goal.
Strech Goal 1
As soon as the funding reaches $13.000, I can produce the glitter PU variant.
 Strech Goal 2
For $20.000 I can produce the premium one with sequins.
 Every subsequent $5.000 allows me to add one more strap color!
At the end of the campaign, each backer will have the option to freely choose between the base variants, or to upgrade to sequins at a discount.
         It reacts to the music with a microphone and shoots lasers, changes the colors of the roses, and even looks awesome during daylight.
I programmed everything myself and will create custom animations for each buyer, if you have any wishes!
Technical specs:
Self made garland with white plastic roses
26x WS2812b RGB LEDs underneath the roses
9x red 5mw lasers inside the roses
Arduino Nano microcontroller
Microphone
2x Li-Ion batteries
1x Micro USB battery charger
PLAY

  A team effort by Lichtfetisch. Very large and complicated machinery, I'd LOVE to see this on the Burning Man playa.
Unfortunately, due to U.S. regulations regarding lasers over 5mW of output power, I'm unable to offer this in the campaign.
Technical specs:
Steel deer head with:
10x 1700mw blue lasers (Class 4b!)
2x 700mw red lasers with custom scanners
1x 1000w fog machine
2x 100w RGBW LEDs
1x custom DMX controller
Not easy to handle.
   Everything is ready, the final prototypes are perfect, I only need the money to order it.
Shipment for all Kickstarter orders will be via trackable EMS, will take 15-20 days, and already handle customs etc for you. So no extra costs!
    I'm a DevOps Engineer from Berlin, studied and dropped out of Computer Science, and fell in love with Techno, Lights and Lasers.
    PLAY
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have years of experience with producing reliable festival gimmicks, and these are the best I've come up with.

The supplier I found is also very reliable and all prototypes are high quality.
The final prototypes meet all specifications.

Possible risks:
- Low quality of El-Wire
My supplier has high standards as well and carefully chose the El-Wire supplier, one of the only ones that does tensile testing with the wire.
The outside wire is the only part that has to withstand everyday use, and also is the part that's easily exchangeable.
I will provide free replacement wires within the first year!
- Material unavailability
Sequin materials with satisfying quality are hard to acquire.
This will be solved until production starts.
Worst case scenario is a "downgrade" to the PVC or PU materials.
- Lost during transit
If a package is lost during transit, I will resend it. All shipments are traceable.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Dear backer,
I regret to have to inform you about a major delay for the delivery of your Funkelbag(s).
Kickstarter transfered the money on the first of June, at which time the production was supposed to start.
Until now, it still hasn't.
No money is lost though, the product will happen, but it will happen slightly later.

Hurray! We're at 100%! Thank you for your support!
I have some awesome and some OK news!
OK news first:
Due to an unfortunate naming conflict (incomplete research on my part), I'm renaming Lumibag to Funkelbag!
This also makes my following products easier to name: Funkelhat, Funkelcrown, Funkelwrist, Funkelchoke ;), etc.!

campaign.story:
Legal Termination of a Warlock... and Other Tales
I think urban fantasy can be a bit too serious and portentous at times, don't you?  Be warned, we're about to proceed with all due sarcasm.
Mister Lewis calls himself a "physics consultant," but what he really consultants on are problems that defy the laws of physics.  Problems like whether there's a supernatural reason all those musicians are dying or how to build an ironclad legal case for firing a warlock from your company.  And like any consultant, he frequently finds himself doing unpleasant work for unpleasant people.
It's a genre bender filtering urban fantasy, horror and detective fiction through a sardonic worldview.  The influences are The Night Stalker by way of Raymond Chandler, Dashiell Hammett and Art Buchwald.
I've already written a couple stories about Mister Lewis and I'd like to try something a little different as I move forward with the series.  I'd like to write a story each month - a novelette or longish short story.  I'm calling it novelettes, but if you wanted to call a monthly e-zine, I wouldn't argue with you.  The idea is to have a new story show up each month like an issue of Batman... except without the serials and annoying crossover events.
What will these read like?  Lucky you, I've already written two adventures and they're online for free, so you can make an informed decision:
The Samples
Read on Medium
     All the Dead Musicians: Why were so many musicians suddenly dying? Why was a certain aging rocker infamous for his overindulgence still standing and the younger musicians weren’t? Something is very wrong in the music industry and this time it’s not a publicity stunt.
Read on Medium
    The Curse of the Goat: The baseball team was poised to go all the way, but there was a problem: they played in a cursed ballpark. As the curse spills out of the ballpark and into the drunken throngs surrounding it, an alderman obsessed with redevelopment is drawn into conflict with a sinister and entitled group of NIMBYs bent on a sports-free neighborhood. Mister Lewis has been hired to clean up the mess, but the Curse of the Goat wants blood.
The Stories for This Project
What I am looking to write?  Topics and titles are subject to change if inspiration strikes, but the current slate is:

Legal Termination of a Warlock: The tech startup really needs to fire somebody before the sexual harassment suits start dropping, so why not that employee they're sure is a warlock?  After all, nobody wants an older employee at a tech company, but how do document cause for termination on a warlock?

The Gentrified Bodega: The building was sold.  The neighborhood was said to be improving and those condos were going to fetch a pretty penny.  There's just one problem - the bodega on the first floor wasn't always a bodega and there was something that didn't want to move out.

The Hipster From Hell: You expect hipsters to worship irony.  You don't expect prayers to irony to get answered, but then again, who makes a blood sacrifice to irony?

Surveillance From Beyond the Veil: Wire taps?  Fine.  Computer viruses? Fine. Corporate spies that literally haunt the walls?  That's a different type of clean up.

 The Soul Tariff: A tax on departing souls causes a backup at the funeral parlor.

 Term Limits Don't Matter If You Have Enough Children: An old acquaintance resurfaces and takes nepotism to unheard of levels.
How would I be receiving these stories?  With a download code for a .PDF or .ePub file.  And you'll be getting it a month before anything goes up on the major bookstores sites like Amazon and Barnes & Noble.
What are the Premium offerings? Three things: at the $50 level, your name will be included on a patron's page at the beginning of the ebook.  At the $100, a character in one of the stories will be named after you and said character will die a horrible death.  Be warned: your namesake might not be a pleasant person.  And if you really, really want some Lovecraft material... look to the bottom of the rewards list.
Have I done this writing thing before? I'm a member of Mystery Writers of America, best known on the fiction side of things for writing a webcomic for the Chicago Tribune Media Group.  Over on the journalism side, I was a contributing editor to one TIME's Top 25 Blogs of 2012 and written for Chicago Tribune, New York Resident, Publishers Weekly, Startup Grind, The Next Web, The Beat and Comic Book Resources.  I get around a little.
How did you arrive at that number for the goal? I need to redirect time from other projects to adhere to a monthly schedule.  It's not that big a deal to reallocate my time, but those student loan people want their money!  So I'm essentially calculating that minimum as a percentage of my grad school loans.  (Education being the gift that keeps on giving... you a bill each month.)
Go ahead and have a look at the first two stories.  If you like what you see or you like what's on the menu, please consider making a pledge.

I just need to sit down and do some writing.

The general risks are me being hit by a bus or similarly incapacitated.

You're a person of distinction and a patron of the arts. Don't you deserve to have your name listed as an official sponsor of these stories? I think you do!
Six months of stories and each month, your name will appear on the dedication/patron page.

updates.update_userinfo: Last Week For Memes From Hell, the Legal Termination of a Warlock Sequel
updates.update_content:
Just a reminder that Memes From Hell, the sequel series to Legal Termination of a Warlock is about to enter it's final week at Kickstarter.
If you enjoyed Legal Termination of a Warlock, have a look at: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1524990961/hardboiled-magic-the-memes-from-hell?ref=kaiugx&utm_source=LTW

updates.update_userinfo: Closing Time... But the Sequel Project Is Now Open
updates.update_content:
Everyone should have gotten the final installment yesterday (Term Limits Don't Matter If You Have Enough Children - ping me if the spam filter ate the message with the download code).
I've launched a sequel campaign: Hardboiled Magic: The Memes From Hell to continue the Mister Lewis stories for another 8 months.
If you liked Legal Termination of a Warlock, I hope you'll consider signing on for The Memes From Hell.

As we head into the final week, I'm about to sit down and finish the first draft of the initial story in the sequence, the titular "Legal Termination of a Warlock."
Which means we should be able to get things going shortly after Kickstarter's post-campaign holding period and everything is on schedule.

campaign.story:
Final Stretch Goal: $125,000 for interactive experiences
Once again, the generosity of the community of Jim Henson fans has surpassed our wildest expectations! Thanks to all of you who helped us reach our stretch goal of $100,000 to support the conservation of puppets in the Museum’s Jim Henson Collection.  
For the remainder of our Kickstarter campaign, we invite you to help support the production of the two interactive experiences in The Jim Henson Exhibition as we strive for a second and final stretch goal of $125,000. These interactive experiences are key ingredients in the exhibition, and with additional funding, we can build them as imagined. They demonstrate two of Henson’s most significant innovations: puppetry for the television screen and puppet character design.  
“Perform a Puppet on Screen” gives visitors an opportunity to experience first-hand what it is like to watch themselves perform a puppet on a television monitor. When they’re finished, they will be able to email a video of their performance to themselves. 
The “Design an Anything Muppet Character” experience begins with a short video featuring Henson puppet-builder Rollie Krewson demonstrating how she designs “Anything Muppet” characters for Sesame Street. Visitors will be able to select facial features and accessories for an “Anything Muppet” form, and see what their character looks like on screen.  
These two interactive experiences will allow visitors to get creative and discover their inner character designer and puppeteer!
Stretch Goal: $100,000 to restore more puppets!
We are so grateful for the outpouring of support from the community of Jim Henson fans! Your generosity has enabled us to meet our goal of $40,000 to preserve and install the puppets in The Jim Henson Exhibition in just two days!
We hope you will continue to support us and help us spread the word about this campaign, as we extend our efforts to preserve Jim’s legacy: we are setting a new goal of $100,000, which will help us restore more puppets in the Museum’s Jim Henson collection. The Jim Henson Exhibition at MoMI and its traveling version, The Jim Henson Exhibition: Imagination Unlimited, will feature many of Jim’s unique puppets, but there are many more “waiting in the wings” for their turn! As The Jim Henson Exhibition is a permanent exhibition at the Museum, the puppets in the original installation will rotate off at times for routine conservation, and it is imperative that other puppets be ready to take their place!
The Museum’s Jim Henson collection includes puppets from all of Jim’s work for film and television. To name just a few: 
Kermit the Frog, Miss Piggy, Scooter, Dr. Bunsen Honeydew, Rowlf, Beaker, Gonzo, Zoot, the Swedish Chef, the Koozebanians, and Camilla from The Muppet Show; 
Big Bird, Elmo, Count von Count, Grover, Cookie Monster, Prairie Dawn, Ernie and Bert from Sesame Street; 
Junior Gorg, Doozers, and all the Fraggles from Fraggle Rock; 
Jen, Kira, Aughra, Pod people and a Skeksis and Mystic from The Dark Crystal; 
Rare puppets from Jim’s television commercials and other early work in the 1950s and 1960s, including Yorick from Sam and Friends, the LaChoy Dragon, Wilkins and Wontkins, Sir Linit, Taminella Grinderfall, the “Java” puppets, and the Tastee Freeze Boss; 
Puppets from Emmet Otter’s Jugband Christmas, The Muppet Musicians of Bremen, Faffner Hall, and much more! 
We cannot thank you enough for your overwhelming support. We are thrilled to be working with you all to preserve this unique and important collection for generations to come.
With a generous gift of hundreds of puppets and artifacts from the Henson family, Museum of the Moving Image in New York City plans to open a brand new, permanent exhibition dedicated to the work of legendary puppeteer and director Jim Henson. Over the course of a singular career, Henson created stories and characters for television and film that have delighted and inspired generations of fans around the world — from the glamorous Miss Piggy and the gentle Grover, to the mystical creatures of The Dark Crystal. The Jim Henson Exhibition will share the full story of Henson’s unique talent, and the deeply collaborative creative process behind his work.
What will the exhibition include?
The exhibition will feature more than 40 original puppets — including Kermit the Frog, Miss Piggy, Elmo, Cookie Monster, the Fraggles, and a Skeksis from The Dark Crystal — as well as puppet prototypes, original character sketches, rare behind-the-scenes footage and photographs, and interactive puppetry design and performance experiences.
Sections of the exhibition will be devoted to:
Henson’s early work for television and film in the 1950s and 60s, in which his unbridled imagination, wit, and capacity for creative innovation were clearly established 
Sesame Street, where his remarkably expressive puppets have delighted children for generations 
The Muppet Show and Muppet feature films, which have had an indelible impact on popular culture 
and the imaginary worlds of Fraggle Rock, The Dark Crystal, and Labyrinth
Preserving the puppets for future generations
The Jim Henson Collection at Museum of the Moving Image includes approximately 175 historic puppets, such as Kermit the Frog, Miss Piggy, Big Bird, Ernie, Bert, Elmo, the Fraggles, Jen and Kira from The Dark Crystal, and many, many more. The restoration of this important collection is an ongoing collaboration between the Museum and Jim Henson’s Creature Shop, with input from fine art conservators. The Museum is honored to be working with the designers and builders at the legendary Creature Shop to restore and preserve the puppets for future generations.
About the traveling exhibition
The Museum is excited to launch a traveling version of the exhibition, The Jim Henson Exhibition: Imagination Unlimited, which will tour around the country and the world! The tour kicks off at Seattle’s Museum of Pop Culture on May 20, 2017. We are thrilled that the flagship and traveling versions of the exhibition will reach such a large, diverse audience.
About the screenings and public programs 
The Museum is already a busy hub of Henson-related activity and programming: we host monthly screenings of Henson’s work that draw a large, enthusiastic audience, and we have piloted an engaging slate of education and family programs related to the exhibition, which will serve school groups and families all year long.
Why Kickstarter? 
The lasting, universal appeal of Henson’s work is unprecedented. People of all ages continue to be delighted and inspired by Jim Henson’s stories and characters. We’re excited to use Kickstarter to connect with Henson fans around the world, and bring this global community together to support a permanent exhibition honoring his creative legacy.
What will your contributions support? 
The City of New York awarded the Museum a generous grant that has enabled us to build the gallery in which this important and inspiring exhibition will be housed. Construction of the gallery space is complete and plans for the exhibition have been finalized.

But we need your support to bring the rest of this incredible exhibition to life, in time for the 2017 school year. Your pledges will help us complete the important work of restoring the puppets in the Museum’s Henson Collection and fabricating and installing the display cases for the puppets and other artifacts. 
Your contributions will ensure that hundreds of thousands of visitors from around the world will be inspired by the creative process behind Jim Henson’s work, and be able to get up close and personal with such beloved puppet characters as Kermit the Frog, Miss Piggy, Elmo, Big Bird, the Fraggles, and many more.
Rewards
Video credits  
Video production by Slam! Media Group 
 Producer: Glen Hoffman 
 Camera: Peter Trilling, Stas Bilyavskiy 
 Audio: Evan Manners, Jordan Moser 
 Editing: Neil Miller, Thomas Dexter 
 Music: Elias
Special thanks to the estate of Jack L. Hiller for permission to use his photographs.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If our funding goal is not met, it is likely that The Jim Henson Exhibition will not open in summer 2017, which is our target date. Once we have the necessary funds in hand, there is nothing that stands in our way of bringing The Jim Henson Exhibition to life!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: Four packs of Farscape in motion cards
support.descp:
Only true Jim Henson fans know that The Jim Henson Company co-produced Farscape, a sci-fi television series that ran from 1999 to 2003. The Jim Henson Company was responsible for the various alien make-up designs and prostheses, and two regular characters (the animatronic puppets Rygel and Pilot) are Creature Shop creations. This reward includes four 4-packs of Farscape in motion lenticular cards (16 cards total). Some card packs include a “from the archives” costume card, a sound in motion audio card, or a hand-numbered archive collection cards.
INCLUDES:
Four 4-packs of Farscape in motion lenticular cards
Exclusive behind-the-scenes updates
Your name on the Museum’s Website

updates.update_userinfo: A rare evening with Frank Oz on September 22 (discount enclosed)
updates.update_content: An Evening with Frank Oz

Dear Henson Kickstarter Backers,
We are working hard to complete the exhibition for the opening next week!!! We are also shipping rewards every week, and notifications are going out as those packages are being mailed. Thank you for your patience with us as we go through rewards for over 2,000 backers!
Please note that the exhibition opens to the public on July 22. On July 21, we have our Kickstarter Day. An invitation was emailed a few weeks ago. If for some reason you missed the opening invitation, please message us and we will coordinate this with you directly.

updates.update_userinfo: A message from The Jim Henson Exhibition Curator
updates.update_content:
Thank you for your understanding and patience as we worked through some technical issues associated with our Kickstarter webpage acknowledging the names of all our amazing Kickstarter Campaign backers for The Jim Henson Exhibition. The page is back up and can be accessed here, where you will see your name among a long list of fellow Henson fans!
For those backers who have not filled out our survey yet, as soon as you do so, we will add your names to the list.

updates.update_userinfo: Backer Acknowledgment page is back up!
updates.update_content:
We are excited to announce that the long-awaited The Jim Henson Exhibition opens Saturday, July 22, thanks in large part to all of your support!  
This dynamic visitor experience—housed in a new gallery space funded by the City of New York—explores Henson’s groundbreaking work for film and television and his transformative impact on popular culture. The exhibition features a broad range of artifacts from throughout his remarkable television and film career, and reveals how Henson and his team of builders, performers, and writers brought to life the enduringly popular worlds of , , , , and . It also includes material from Henson’s lesser known and experimental film projects, presenting Henson as a restlessly creative performer, filmmaker, and technical innovator.

Our Kickstarter campaign for The Jim Henson Exhibition has come to a close. In total, we raised $144,230 pledged by 2,072 generous and enthusiastic backers. We at the Museum of the Moving Image cannot even begin to express the gratitude we feel for the overwhelming support this project has received. It has been extremely heartwarming to interact with the global community of Henson fans, and we look forward to meeting many of you once the exhibit opens at the Museum! Stay tuned, an opening date will be announced shortly.

updates.update_userinfo: The Jim Henson Exhibition opens July 22!
updates.update_content: With just 24 hours remaining, our campaign has exceeded $140,000 in pledges and surpassed 2,000 backers. We are blown away by these tremendous milestones and the support we have received. We cannot thank you enough!

campaign.story:
Facebook | Web | PressKit | #teardownthiswall
TEAR DOWN THIS WALL!
¡Derriben este muro!
Join us as we initiate a huge happening along the 2000 mile U.S.-Mexican border to protest against nationalism and isolation worldwide!
Deutsch | Español | Italiano | Français
Hello! We are the Dresdner Sinfoniker, a contemporary symphony orchestra from Germany.
On 3rd June 2017, we will stage a concert on both sides of the U.S.-Mexican border. We have invited musicians from the United States and Mexico to play along with us at Friendship Park between Tijuana and San Diego.
Become part of a huge happening!
We want musicians, bands, artists, performers and basically everyone who wants to speak up for liberty and human rights to join us by initiating their own performances along the wall on 3rd June 2017.
With this happening we are not only protesting against President Trump’s proposed border wall, but also against the isolation and nationalist policies around the world. Together, we will demonstrate that music knows no boundaries and art can help to build bridges across all barriers.
Film or photograph your own protest, concert, song, handstand or acrobatics (anything you want, really) everywhere alongside the 2,000 mile U.S.-Mexican border and post it on your Twitter account using the hashtag #teardownthiswall and we will share it on our site tear-down-this-wall.org.
Our concert will be live-streamed online and the event will be professionally filmed. The repertoire will be a wide range of famous pop songs and new works composed especially for the occasion.
About the location
Mexico and the United States meet the Pacific Ocean at Friendship Park. This is also where hundreds of families gather to catch a glimpse of their loved ones through the fence or hug one another during a brief two minute opening of the gates. With this concert we want to show that we are united, despite being divided by walls and borders.
Friendship Park © Maria Teresa Fernandez
Why Kickstarter?
We are turning to Kickstarter because we need to raise €15,000 to make this project a reality. We will tour Mexico and the funds will only be used for domestic flights, accommodation, event support and professional video documentation. We are a non-profit organisation and rely on public funding, grants, and individual benefactors.
We want a community of like-minded people who are concerned about current policies of isolation and nationalist tendencies of our governments. Join our protest with #teardownthiswall and stage your own event anywhere along the 2000 mile border!
We have seen this before
Being from former East Germany we have witnessed the impact of isolation and political walls. It is a bad idea!
Together we will raise our voices like the citizens of East Germany did during their peaceful revolution.
30 years ago Ronald Reagan told the world and Mr Gorbachev to 'Tear down this wall!'
Rewards
Every pledge level will receive a personalised thank you certificate signed by the Dresdner Sinfoniker. Every pledge level from €25 onwards will receive a high quality WAV recording of the concert.

Postcards from Dresden or Mexico:

You will receive a postcard, either from Dresden or Mexico City.

One of three Dresdner Sinfoniker CDs:
If you pledge for the €100 reward, you will receive one of the following CDs: 
• Music from Tajikistan, Georgia, Azerbeijan and Armenia
• Hasretim: Journey to Anatolia 
• Mein Herz brennt - Songs scored to Rammstein Lyrics
Dresdner Sinfoniker CDs
The following rewards are all in collaboration with award winning photographer Kai Wiedenhöfer who has travelled the world and documented political walls in more than 20 countries.
Exclusive set of Postcards:
You will receive three postcards of photographs from Kai Wiedenhöfers 'Confrontier' book. Printed on 315gsm paper.
Kai Wiedenhöfer postcards
'Confrontier' book by Kai Wiedenhöfer:
In this book Kai has documented borders from 1989-2010. 184 pages with 8 gatefolds Hardback / Hardcover 9 x13in. / 23x33cm. Paperbound hardcover with foil embossing. More images of the book here.
'Confrontier' by Kai Wiedenhöfer © Peter Byrne

Kai Wiedenhöfer artwork:
Your choice of a 50cmx150cm print from three motifs. Own your personal piece of wall-art! 
Kai Wiedenhöfer artwork 'USA-Mexico on Hill'
  Kai Wiedenhöfer artwork 'Tijuana'
  Kai Wiedenhöfer artwork 'Mountain Ridge'
  Who we are
We have been combining music with socio-political issues for over 20 years. In 2016, we managed to create international headlines with our German-Turkish-Armenian concert aghet - ağıt, a project in memory of the Armenian genocide.
We know what civil courage and free thinking can achieve, most of our members witnessed the German reunification first hand. In 1989 our CEO and Artistic Director Markus Rindt fled East Germany, using the German embassy in Prague as a passage to freedom.
We hope you will join us on our mission. Tear down this wall and prevent new ones from being built!
Dresdner Sinfoniker in 2016
Timeline
April 6th 2017: Kickstarter Launch.
April - June 2017: Preparations and rehearsals.
June 1st 2017: Orchestra flies to Mexico City and on to Tijuana.
June 2nd 2017: Full rehearsal.
June 3rd 2017: Concert on both sides of the US-Mexican border with musicians from Mexico and the US. 
June 8th-10th 2017: Concerts in Mexico City.
June 11th 2017: Orchestra flies back to Germany.
July 2017: Production of rewards.
August 2017: Shipping of all rewards.
Special Thanks
In the last 20 years, the Dresdner Sinfoniker have received incredible support from many individuals. We are very grateful for all contributions which enable us to stage our projects.

Supported by sidekickcreatives.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our biggest challenge is the current political climate. We are confident that we can deliver a great concert, however it is possible that the officials who grant us permission to perform, may change their mind if they feel politically uncomfortable about this event.

It is also a challenge to expose as many people as possible to our project, hoping that we will win them over. Supporters who will stage their own event may run into difficulties with the local authorities.

We will keep you updated with all the news and challenges.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: A Special Pledge (New)
support.descp:
Get one of 150 VIP tickets for our next concert on June 17th 2017 at Dresden’s Frauenkirche: An angry chorus with orchestra at the Frauenkirche: inspired by the antique myth of the goddess Hera, who struck the hero Heracles with blind fury so that he killed his children in his rage, Elfride Jelinek writes about the rage of Islamist terrorists and German »Wutbürger« (»angry citizens«), about angry gods, fathers and sons. The conductor, composer and filmmaker Christian von Borries stages Jelinek’s new text together with actors from the Dresden State Theater and Orchestra at the Frauenkirche. He combines the texts with excerpts from »Siegfrieds Tod«, Mendelssohn’s »Reformation Symphony«, Passions by Bach and Mozart’s Requiem. Woven into this production is the unfinished fragment »Jesus von Nazareth« by Richard Wagner, reconstructed here for the first time.
http://www.musikfestspiele.com/en/program-tickets/#e403
Be our VIP guest and meet the Artistic Director and the Dresdner Sinfoniker after the performance at our party

updates.update_userinfo: ...a heartfelt thank you to all of you!
updates.update_content:
Dear Friends and Supporters,
thank you for your magnificent help: TEAR DOWN THIS WALL! has become an extraordinary event! On 3rd June 2017 we staged a music festival in Tijuana directly at the border wall: Musicians, painters, installation artists, performance artists and audience members from the US and Mexico - they all came, participated and protested isolation and fanaticism: A day to remember!

Dear Friends and Supporters,
We celebrated a magnificent festival day yesterday here in Tijuana :)
Have a look here:
http://www.tagesschau.de/multimedia/video/video-295289.html
More to come soon, stay tuned!
www.tear-down-this-wall.org

updates.update_userinfo: Anyone can join! Please spread the word!
TEAR DOWN THIS WALL! musicians is denied permission to perform on the American side of the border in San Diego. The festival will go ahead regardless.
updates.update_content:
Dear Friends and Supporters!
Our TEAR DOWN THIS WALL! musicians is denied permission to perform on the American side of the border in San Diego. But the festival will go ahead regardless. Our effort to take a collective and artistic stand against the global rise of isolationism, fanaticism and nationalism, has been refused permission by US authorities. The planned cross-border interaction, featuring the Dresdner Sinfoniker alongside American and Mexican musicians on either side, is therefore suspended. The free festival will now take place exclusively on the Mexican side of the border, between 11 am and 4 pm on 3 June 2017.

Dear Friends and supporters - let's present the great pieces of music the Dresdner Sinfoniker-Septet will play on 3rd June 2017 on the US-Mexican border in Tijuana/San Diego:
• Gloria Estefan: Tres Gotas de Agua Bendita
• Juan Formell y Los Van Van: Yo no lo temo a la vida

Dear Friends and Supporters,
Dear fellow Artists and Musicians,
On 3rd June 2017, the Dresdner Sinfoniker and their friends will perform in Friendship Park, Tijuana/San Diego with musicians and singers from Mexico and the US. Join us on that day with your own performance or initiative anywhere along the 2000 mile-long border and share your videos/photos on social media using the hashtag #teardownthiswall.

Thanks to all of you we reached our goal.
We are super excited. Whoohoo. We couldn't have done it without you. Looking forward to a great happening on June 3rd, which is only possible because all of you backed us. Thank you so much.
Have a great day, we will keep you posted.

comments.content: I just got it last week! Thanks! Best regards from Mexico.

I have supported your campaign both as an american and as a pastor. My faith informs me that we are called to break down walls and help our neighbor. Whatever informs your decision to do precisely this, I give you my thanks for your courage and commitment to this project. May your project help expand our worldview.

There's so much opposition to this project in these comments... I feel the obligation to leave my positive opinion. I think this is going to be an incredible display of public art, and I look forward to seeing it unfold. I'm from Texas, and I believe if Germans feel passionate about American and South American issues, that passion should never be written off as less meaningful, and in fact could offer a very powerful, new message from an outsider's perspective. Thank you Desdner for making this happen and best of luck!
So, I really hope that there will be a lot of music along the wall on June 3rd, and I suggest as an enhanced motto "Tear down this wall and all others, visible and invisible!"
Prokopfgeldspende 24.04.2017
#NoPegida! #NoHateJustLove
#prokopfgeldspende #noracism
